comments:
3.0 M2
There's a missing null check in the rm(file) method which is causing an NPE when
running my applications.

Created an attachment (id=14878)
patch to DefaultAdapter#rm

Can you give us some more information on how you reproduced this.  It seems 
like the only way this can happen is if there is an I/O error occurs during the 
call to file.list().  The javadoc to File.list() is the following:

Returns an array of strings naming the files and directories in the directory 
denoted by this abstract pathname. The array will be empty if the directory is 
empty. Returns null if this abstract pathname does not denote a directory, or 
if an I/O error occurs.

We check to see that the directory exists and that it is really a directory 
before making this call.  Is there some kind of disk failure?  I agree we 
should probably make perform a null check but what should we do if the result 
is null?  This would be an error that should likely be logged.

I was launching two applications with no workspace (@none), the applications at
startup read configuration scoped preferences. It doesn't happen all the time
though.

Jean-Michel, do you have a log file with the stack trace available?  I think 
the key here is that you are running two different applications from the same 
eclipse install.  It seems like the two are trying to remove the same directory 
at the same time.  The simple solution is to handle the null case, but I would 
like to understand more about what is happening.

I'm overflowing with log files but I may of found an interesting one:
